Wheel.Text: TASK: Initiate a Direct Line I.V.

steps.Name: Spike IV Bag and Prepare IV Tubing
Apply Constricting Band

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Band should be placed 6-8 inches above venipuncture site.
Choose the most distal and accessible vein of an uninjured arm or hand.
Apply the constricting band tight enough to stop venous flow but not so tightly that the radial pulse cannot be felt.
Tell the patient to open and close his fist several times to increase circulation.
Avoid sites over joints and infected or injured areas

Wheel.Text: Apply Constricting Band

steps.Name: Cleanse Insertion Site with Alcohol Wipe

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: use a firm circular motion from the center outward
allow the skin to dry

Wheel.Text: Cleanse Insertion Site with Alcohol Wipe

steps.Name: Hold Skin Taught Distal to Site of Veinipuncture

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: use your non-dominant hand to hold the skin
Position yourself so as to have a direct line of vision along the axis of the vein to be  entered.

Wheel.Text: Hold Skin Taught Distal to Site of Veinipuncture

steps.Name: Hold needle at a 20-30 degree angle, bevel up, over top of the venipuncture site.

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Place the forefinger on the needle hub to guide it during insertion through the skin and into the vein

Wheel.Text: Hold needle at a 20-30 degree angle, bevel up, over top of the venipuncture site.

steps.Name: Pierce Skin, Advance Catheter UNTIL Blood Appears In Flash Chamber

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Keep the needle at the same angle to prevent through-and-through penetration of the vein walls.

Wheel.Text: Pierce Skin, Advance Catheter UNTIL Blood Appears In Flash Chamber

steps.Name: Decrease Angle to 10-15 Degree and Advance 1/8th of and Inch

Wheel.Text: Decrease Angle to 10-15 Degree and Advance 1/8th of and Inch

steps.Name: Advance the Catheter Until Hub Touches Skin OR Significant Resistance Felt

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: While continuing to hold the hub, press lightly on the skin over the catheter tip with the fingers of the other hand.
NOTE: This prevents the backflow of blood from the hub.
Remove the needle from inside the catheter.

Wheel.Text: Advance the Catheter Until Hub Touches Skin OR Significant Resistance Felt

steps.Name: Release the Constricting Band with the Non-dominant Hand

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Tell patient to unclench fist

Wheel.Text: Release the Constricting Band with the Non-dominant Hand

steps.Name: Occlude the Vein with the Non-dominant Hand

Wheel.Text: Occlude the Vein with the Non-dominant Hand

steps.Name: Remove the Needle and Place it in a Sharps Container

Wheel.Text: Remove the Needle and Place it in a Sharps Container

steps.Name: Connect IV Tubing, Place Strip of 1IN tape over Hub, and Initiate Flow of Fluids

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: A rate of about 30 cc per hour, or 7 to 10 drops per minute using standard drip tubing, is adequate to keep the vein open.

Wheel.Text: Connect IV Tubing, Place Strip of 1IN tape over Hub, and Initiate Flow of Fluids

steps.Name: On Catheter - Place Strip of 1 inch tape over Cover with Transparent Dressing

Wheel.Text: On Catheter - Place Strip of 1 inch tape over Cover with Transparent Dressing

steps.Name: Assess IV site for any Signs/Symptoms of Infiltration

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Stop infusion immediatly if puncture sight is: red, cool to touch, swollen, or leaking

Wheel.Text: Assess IV site for any Signs/Symptoms of Infiltration

steps.Name: Secure IV Tubing to the Casualty

Wheel.Text: Secure IV Tubing to the Casualty
TASK: Pressure Bandage
Take Body Substance Isolation
Expose Wound

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Gauze should extend 1-2 inches above the skin

Wheel.Text: Pack Wound with Gauze

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: Place WHITE portion down

Wheel.Text: Cover Wound with Dressing

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Wrap with the Elastic Portion of the Bandage

Wheel.Text: Wrap Bandage Around Extremity
Insert Elastic Wrap into Pressure Bar

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: At the same time bandage in the opposite direction

Wheel.Text: Apply Pressure with Pressure Bar

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: Ensure ALL edges of of wound pad are COVERED

Wheel.Text: Continue to Wrap Wound TIGHTLY
Secure the Closure Bar to the Bandage

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: do NOT remove from limb

Wheel.Text: Loosen the Tourniquet

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Controlled Bleeding: Secure Bandage with Tape
Bleeding Reoccurs (1): Retighten tourniquet until bleeding stops and Radial Pulse ABSENT
Bleeding Reoccurs (2): Secure bandage with tape

Wheel.Text: Check Bleeding: Controlled or Reoccurs

steps.Name: TAS:

Wheel.Text: TASK: Surgical Cricothyrotomy

steps.Name: Take Body Substance Isolation

Wheel.Text: Take Body Substance

steps.Name: Hyperextend Neck

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Tilt the casualty's head back

Wheel.Text: Identify the cricothyroid membrane between the cricoid and thyroid cartilages.

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Thyroid cartilage = Adam's apple, Largest distal lump
Cricoid cartilage = Largest proximal lump
Cricothyroid Membrane = depression between Thyroid and Cricoid cartilage

Wheel.Text: Clean the site with alcohol wipe.

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: confirm landmarks with non-dominant index finger
NOTE: do not remove non-dominate hand until tracheal hook is in place

Wheel.Text: Stabilize the larynx with non-dominant hand using thumb and middle finger

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: Avoid areas around Larynx (red lines on left and right)
NOTE: Do NOT pierce the membrane with this cut, only cut skin

Wheel.Text: Make 1-inch VERTICAL Incision through skin over Cricothyroid Membrane
Reconfirm cricothyroid membrane with index finger

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Use Thumb and Middle Finger of non-dominat hand to Stabalize
Use Index Finger of this hand to confirm landmark positions
NOTE: Keep non-domaint hand in place UNITL hook is placed

Wheel.Text: Turn scalpel horizontally and poke through the cricothyroid membrane. Make 1/2 inch incision.
Insert Hook and Elevate Cricoid Cartilage

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Remove Obstruction (if applicable)
If an ETT, insert 1/4 - 1 inch beyond the cuff

Wheel.Text: Insert the end of the tube fully into the trachea and direct towards the lungs.
Inflate the cuff with 10 ml of air.

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Watch for equal rise and fall of chest to confim tube placement

Wheel.Text: Ventilate the Casualty Twice with a BVM, Auscultate the Apex of RIGHT and LEFT lung
Assess casualty for spontaneous respirations. (must count for 10 seconds) and attach pulse oximeter to casualty.

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: IF YES: ventilate casualty with a BVM, if no -- next step

Wheel.Text: Ventilate casualty if: respirations <8 or >30, pulse oximeter <90%
Apply a Dressing around the Tube
Secure device to the casualty around casualty's neck with strap or tape.

steps.Name: TASK: Needle Chest Decompression

Wheel.Text: TASK: Needle Chest Decompression

steps.Name: View Anatomy and Get Needle Decompression Tools

Wheel.Text: Get Needle Decompression Tools

steps.Name: Ensure Condition is due to Progressive Respiratory Distress, Secondary to Torso Trauma

Wheel.Text: Ensure Condition is due to Progressive Respiratory Distress, Secondary to Torso Trauma

steps.Name: Locate the Second Intercostal Space(SIS) - Prepare with Antiseptic Solution

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Approximately two finger widths below the clavicle
Between the second and third ribs -  at the midclavicular line
Approximately in line with the nipple - on the same side of the casualtys chest as the injury.

Wheel.Text: Locate the Second Intercostal Space(SIS) - Prepare with Antiseptic Solution

steps.Name: Firmly insert Needle and Catheter unit (3 1/4 inch - 14 gauge)  into the SIS

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: The needle-catheter unit should be at a 90 degree angle with respect to the chest wall
Verifiy insertion - indicated by a "pop" or "hiss" as needle enters chest cavity

Wheel.Text: Firmly insert Needle and Catheter unit (3 1/4 inch - 14 gauge)  into the SIS

steps.Name: Remove Needle, Leaving the Catheter in Place

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: NOTE: the casualtys respiration should improve.

Wheel.Text: Remove Needle, Leaving the Catheter in Place

steps.Name: Secure the Catheter Hub to the Chest

Wheel.Text: Secure the Catheter Hub to the Chest

steps.Name: Place the Casualty in a Sitting Position or Recovery Position with Injured Side Down

Wheel.Text: Place the Casualty in a Sitting Position or Recovery Position with Injured Side Down

steps.Name: Monitor the casualty until medical care arrives

DisplayAnchoredText.Text: Check for reoccurrence of respiratory distress

Wheel.Text: Monitor the casualty until medical care arrives
